title: Manikyam and Mutyala Jadau Haaram: Emerald and Pearl Diamond Necklace
materials: South Sea Pearls (Mutyalu). Features Hyderabadi Jadau craftsmanship known for its intricate gem setting.
features: This exquisite Haaram showcases the timeless Jadau technique, where uncut diamonds are meticulously embedded into the gold. The floral motifs are intricately detailed, reminiscent of Mughal-era designs. The pendant features a central pear-shaped Emerald surrounded by a halo of diamonds. Delicate pearl drops (Mutyala Guchu) add a touch of classic South Indian elegance.
colors: and Creamy White Pearls. The traditional color combination is considered auspicious and brings prosperity.
occasions: Perfect for a grand occasion such as a wedding (Vivaha Mahotsavam)
or any festive celebration. An ideal piece for the bride (Vadhuvu) or to be gifted during a Seemantham (baby shower) or Half-Saree Function (Langa Voni Function).
description: This Jadau Haaram is a masterpiece of Hyderabadi craftsmanship. The use of high-quality Emeralds and South Sea Pearls, combined with the brilliance of the diamonds, makes it a truly luxurious piece. The intricate design reflects the rich cultural heritage of South India, making it a valuable heirloom piece to be cherished for generations. The traditional significance of Manikyam (Emeralds) and Mutyalu (Pearls) is believed to bring good fortune and prosperity to the wearer.
